metadata.Title: CVE-2013-5645 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Multiple cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in Roundcube webmail before 0.9.3 allow user-assisted remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via the body of a message visited in (1) new or (2) draft mode, related to compose.inc; and (3) might allow remote authenticated users to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via an HTML signature, related to save_identity.inc.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-5645` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

roundcube - 0.9.5-2
roundcube-core - 0.9.5-2
roundcube-mysql - 0.9.5-2
roundcube-pgsql - 0.9.5-2
roundcube-plugins - 0.9.5-2
roundcube-sqlite3 - 0.9.5-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: roundcube package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.9.5-2').
